content:
Please perform an ISAF strategic analysis on this comprehensive dataset:

### COMPANY INFORMATION
- Name: METLEN Energy & Metals (formerly Mytilineos)
- Revenue: €5.68 billion (2024)
- EBITDA: €1.08 billion (all-time high, +6.5% YoY)
- Market Cap: €6.31 billion
- Current market share: 19.4% in Greek retail electricity market
- Operations: 40+ countries
- Credit Rating: BB+ (one notch from investment grade)

### MAJOR PROJECTS
- Gallium facility: €295.5M investment (first in Europe, 50 tonnes/year by 2028)
- PPC solar partnership: €2B cooperation for 2 GW solar development
- UK infrastructure: £2.5B Eastern Green Link subsea project

### OPERATIONAL METRICS
- Thermal Power: 2.041 GW total capacity
- Renewable Energy: 1.4 GW operational, targeting 2 GW additions
- Primary Aluminum: 190,000 tonnes/year
- Bauxite: 1,000,000+ tonnes/year (Europe's largest)
- Energy Storage: 3.5 GWh global pipeline

### COMPETITIVE POSITION
- Only EU company with full bauxite-to-aluminum integration
- 30% market share in UK energy storage
- Key competitors: Norsk Hydro (~€5B revenue), Iberdrola (44.7 GW operational), PPC (€9.7B revenue)

### STRATEGIC TARGETS
- 30% Greek retail electricity market share
- €2 billion medium-term EBITDA target
- Investment grade credit rating achievement
- Net Zero by 2050
